titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Alabama Agricultural and Mechanical University Catalogs, etc. Cubb.00017
titlestmt.author: Kathy Kerns

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-02-20 14:19:44 -0800.

did.unittitle: Alabama Agricultural and Mechanical University (formerly: Alabama Agricultural and Mechanical College; formerly: The State Agricultural and Mechanical Institute for Negroes; formerly: State Normal and Industrial School at Huntsville; formerly: Huntsville Normal School)

physdesc.extent: bound volume of catalogs shelved under Agricultural and Mechanical College for Negroes.

did.abstract: Located in Normal, Alabama (near Huntsville). Established as Huntsville Normal School, changed name to State Normal and Industrial School at Huntsville in 1878, changed name to The State Agricultural and Mechanical Institute for Negroes in 1919, changed name to Alabama Agricultural and Mechanical College in 1948 changed name to Alabama Agricultural and Mechanical University in 1969.

did.unittitle: Huntsville State Normal and Industrial School for Colored Students President's Report
State Colored Normal and Industrial School (Alabama)
State Normal and Industrial School for Colored Students Annual Report of the President
Agricultural and Mechanical College of Alabama for Negroes
Some Strong Facts about the Agricultural and Mechanical College for Negroes, Normal, Alabama
did.abstract: Written by W. H. Councill, President sometime between July 1902 and March 1904.

did.unittitle: Letter from W.H. Councill, President of Agricultural and Mechanical College [for Negroes]
did.abstract: Letter addressed "To the Friends of Negro Education" asking for financial assistance.
